title: Dev chain bug to connect peers on same device .
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2.44.0-dev-ded8283d

OS & Version: PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 22.10"
VERSION="22.10 (Kinetic Kudu)"
VERSION_CODENAME=kinetic
ID_LIKE=debian

Commit hash: 299535e7ea207481268404423fbbd04e05b5635d

Erigon Command (with flags/config): ./erigon --datadir=dev --chain=dev --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --mine --dev.period 2 --port 30307 --log.console.verbosity "debug" 

Concensus Layer: 
Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: Dev chain 

#### Expected behaviour
the port should be opened for node 1 and it should be connected to node2 as a static peer.

#### Actual behaviour

the port is not exposed and it shows : 
INFO[05-08|11:04:12.239] Started P2P networking           version=68 self=enode://d154ea3ea147ed9e3800d9696769f7391c1b25f20c4c60a3fd88885dd7f3712dd09dbb6dfe8bd65d2c03372b128d72658bef1dbb8e66d089ca559c482294f37f@127.0.0.1:0 name=erigon/v2.44.0-dev-299535e7/linux-amd64/go1.20.3

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon.git
cd erigon
git checkout devel
make erigon
./build/bin/erigon
 ./erigon --datadir=dev --chain=dev --private.api.addr=localhost:9090 --mine --dev.period 2 --port 30307 --log.console.verbosity "debug" 
#### Backtrace
